{{EngvarB|date=August 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2014}} '''John''' "'''Jock'''" '''Kane''' (7 April 1921 – 27 September 2013) was a Scottish [[whistleblower]] who was prevented from publishing two books alleging corruption at the British [[intelligence agency]] [[Government Communications Headquarters]] (GCHQ). Kane served with the Royal Air Force in various European theatres as a radio operator in World War II, before joining GCHQ after the war. While serving with GCHQ in Hong Kong, Kane was concerned with the lack of security and after uncovering fraud, raised his complaints with officials. Kane retired in 1978 and his complaints were investigated by a senior civil servant, but the report was never published. Kane wrote a memoir in 1984, ''GCHQ: The Negative Asset'', which was subsequently banned, as was a second memoir, ''The Hidden Depths of Treachery''. Kane later worked as a milkman after retiring from GCHQ.
==Personal life== Kane was born in [[Coatbridge]], [[North Lanarkshire]], in 1921, his mother died in childbirth when he was two.<ref name=TelegOct13>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/obituaries/military-obituaries/special-forces-obituaries/10392405/Jock-Kane.html|title=Obituary: Jock Kane|date=20 October 2013|work=The Daily Telegraph|accessdate=21 October 2013}}</ref> Raised by his father with the help of aunts, he was educated at St Patrick's High School in Coatbridge.<ref name=TelegOct13/> Kane was married twice, first to Alexandra in 1949, with whom he had two sons.<ref name=TelegOct13/> Kane had met Alexandra in Greece, where she had been a member of the [[Greek Resistance]]. Alexandra had been imprisoned during the Second World War for helping to evacuate Allied soldiers stranded there after the [[Battle of Greece]].<ref name=TelegOct13/> Kane married Cynthia, his second wife, in 1983.<ref name=TelegOct13/> After his marriage to Cynthia, Kane moved to [[Barton on Sea]] in Hampshire, where he worked as a milkman and school bus driver.<ref name=TelegOct13/>
==Military and GCHQ career== In 1939, Kane joined the [[Royal Air Force]], training as a [[radio operator]] in Blackpool. With the RAF Kane flew on [[sortie]]s during the [[Battle of the Atlantic]], tasked with calibrating radar signals, to help combat the threat of German submarines to Allied shipping.<ref name=ScotOct13/> Kane also served with RAF squadrons supporting allied forces in North Africa and Italy, and was sent into [[occupied Yugoslavia]] in 1944, and Greece.<ref name=TelegOct13/><ref name=ScotOct13/>
After leaving the RAF at the end of the war, Kane was recruited by intelligence agency [[Government Communications Headquarters|GCHQ]] in November 1946. He was posted to a [[listening station]] at [[Hawklaw Y Station|Hawklaw]], near [[Cupar]] in Fife, Scotland.<ref name=TelegOct13/><ref name="Rusbridger1991">{{cite book|author=James Rusbridger|title=The Intelligence Game: The Illusions and Delusions of International Espionage|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=p62LN9EhsKYC&pg=PA98|year=1991|publisher=I.B.Tauris|isbn=978-1-85043-338-5|pages=98–}}</ref> Raw intelligence material would be supplied by Hawklaw to [[Bletchley Park]] (known as X-Station) to be de-coded.<ref name=ScotOct13>{{cite news|url=http://www.heraldscotland.com/comment/obituaries/john-jock-kane.22487824|title=Radio interceptor for GCHQ|date=24 October 2013|work=The Herald Scotland|accessdate=26 October 2013}}</ref> During the [[Cold War]], the target of Kane's interception efforts at Hawklaw were the [[Soviet Union]] and its allies behind the [[Iron curtain]].<ref name=ScotOct13/> Much of the material collected at Hawklaw would be subsequently transferred to the United States [[National Security Agency]] for further analysis.<ref name=ScotOct13/> The Cupar station was one of a number of British [[Y-stations]], monitoring the radio communications of Soviet naval vessels.<ref name=ScotOct13/>
Kane served with GCHQ in Istanbul, Aden, Singapore, Hong Kong and Belfast.<ref name=TelegOct13/> He retired from GCHQ in November 1978.<ref name="Rusbridger1991"/>
===GCHQ whistleblower=== By the early 1970s Kane had been working for GCHQ for more than 25 years, having worked in almost every section of the organisation.<ref name="Rusbridger1991"/> In 1973, Kane uncovered fraud in GCHQ, concerned with subsistence allowances. Staff sent on training courses had been collecting their full allowance over a weekend, when they were already home.<ref name="Rusbridger1991"/> Fraud that Kane found in the GCHQ outpost of [[RAF Little Sai Wan|Little Sai Wan]] in Hong Kong concerned employees renting apartments at lower rates than their £600 rent allowance, then submitting false invoices for the higher amount, and sharing the difference with their Chinese landlords.<ref name="Rusbridger1991"/> Kane had worked in Hong Kong until 1976.<ref name="West2012">{{cite book|author=Nigel West|title=Historical Dictionary of Signals Intelligence|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=RTEfrBa5VZYC&pg=PA121|date=31 August 2012|publisher=Scarecrow Press|isbn=978-0-8108-7187-8|pages=121–}}</ref> Senior GCHQ officers were also involved in the fraud, and Kane found that senior management at GCHQ were not interested in his complaints. Kane believed that these activities could expose staff to [[blackmail]] by hostile intelligence agencies.<ref name=TelegOct13/><ref name="Rusbridger1991"/> A [[spy ring]] had already been uncovered in Little Sai Wan, with 150 people arrested for spying in Hong Kong from 1970–1976.<ref name="Rusbridger1991"/> His allegations also concerned the loss of secret documents and the collection of material from wastepaper baskets by Chinese cleaners, which he had established by intercepting communications between Chinese intelligence agents.<ref name=TelegOct13/><ref name=ScotOct13/>
Lax security at GCHQ was another target of Kane's allegations.<ref name="Rusbridger1991"/> Kane said that there were no proper controls of photocopiers, with no record of the number of copies taken.<ref name="Rusbridger1991"/> In addition, too many people had access to highly classified material, and staff were often found in high-security areas without the necessary clearance.<ref name="Rusbridger1991"/>
Though Kane was criticised by his GCHQ colleagues for taking security too seriously, he had subsequent meetings with [[Special Branch#United Kingdom|Special Branch]], the [[Director of Public Prosecutions (England and Wales)|Director of Public Prosecutions]], the [[Security Commission]] and Member of Parliament [[Kenneth Warren (politician)|Kenneth Warren]].<ref name="Rusbridger1991"/> Warren subsequently advanced Kane's complaints with Prime Minister [[James Callaghan]]. To investigate Kane's complaints Callaghan appointed a senior civil servant from the Home Office, [[James Waddell (civil servant)|James Waddell]].<ref name="Rusbridger1991"/> Waddell's report was finished in April 1979, and never published. The new Prime Minister, [[Margaret Thatcher]], described Kane's allegations as "unfounded" to Parliament; as a consequence Waddell hinted to a journalist that his report had not concluded that Kane's allegations were without foundation.<ref name="Rusbridger1991"/>
A June 1980 episode of the investigative television show, ''[[World In Action]]'', titled ''Mr Kane's Campaign'', was dedicated to Kane's revelations and campaign for stricter security at GCHQ in Hong Kong.<ref name="Times1980">Peter Dear. "Television." ''The Times'', London, 9 June 1980: pg 25.</ref> The programme was modified after having been restricted from being broadcast by the [[Independent Broadcasting Authority]].<ref name="Times1980"/>
Kane's 1984 memoir, ''GCHQ: The Negative Asset'', was confiscated by Special Branch, and remains unpublished.<ref name="MoranMoran2012"/> The publishers of his first memoir, Robert Hale, were served with an injunction to prevent its publication.<ref name="Rusbridger1991"/> Details of the manuscript of ''The Negative Asset'' were published in ''The Washington Post'' in 1985; Kane denied leaking the manuscript to the newspaper.<ref name="TimesNov85">Michael Binyon, and Stewart Tendler. "Banned GCHQ spy book is leaked." ''The Times'', London, 4 Nov. 1985: pg 32.</ref> Copies of the ''Negative Asset'' were seized from its London publisher and from newspapers that had been considering serialization of its contents; police officers from Special Branch also travelled to New York to seize manuscripts.<ref name="TimesNov85"/>
The publication of Kane's 1987 memoir, ''The Hidden Depths of Treachery'' was also subsequently halted by an injunction served on the publishers [[Transworld Publishers|Transworld Publications, Ltd]].<ref name=TelegOct13/><ref name="Rusbridger1991"/> The two books had been written by Kane following his failure to end what he believed was the widespread existence of fraudulent activities in GCHQ.<ref name=TelegOct13/> Kane was never prosecuted for his actions, which took place alongside the [[Geoffrey Prime]] affair and the [[ABC trial]]. Kane had also provided information to the defendants in the ABC trial.<ref name="MoranMoran2012">{{cite book|author1=Christopher Moran|author2=Christopher R. Moran|title=Classified: Secrecy and the State in Modern Britain|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=p24kPDwzXkUC&pg=PA198|date=13 December 2012|publisher=Cambridge University Press|isbn=978-1-107-00099-5|pages=198–}}</ref> The ''[[Daily Telegraph]]'' said that these events gave the "ring of truth" to Kane's criticisms.<ref name=TelegOct13/>
In July 1988, Kane made an extended appearance on the [[After Dark (TV series)#.22British Intelligence.22|''British Intelligence'' episode]] of the [[Channel 4]] discussion programme ''[[After Dark (TV series)|After Dark]]'', alongside [[Merlyn Rees]], [[Robin Ramsay (editor)|Robin Ramsay]], [[H. Montgomery Hyde]] and others. He discussed with the former home secretary why he had been singled out by the authorities and said, as reported by ''[[The Scotsman]]'', "in reasoned and deliberate voice": "Special Branch arrived at my house in Hampshire on a Sunday morning and I endured three days of intense questioning. I was never arrested or charged."<ref>[http://www.scotsman.com/news/obituaries/obituary-jock-kane-radio-operator-1-3160648 Obituary], ''[[The Scotsman]]'', Alasdair Steven, 28 October 2013, accesssed 13 September 2017</ref>
==See also== * [[List of whistleblowers]] * [[Katharine Gun]]
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
{{authority control}}

revision.text:
[[File:Bundesarchiv Bild 183-2008-0208-501, Ludwig Dettmann.jpg|thumb|300px|Ludwig Dettmann in his ''[[Sturmabteilung]]'' uniform (1935)]] '''Ludwig Julius Christian Dettmann''' (25 July 1865, Adelby, near [[Flensburg]] - 19 November 1944, [[Berlin]]) was a German [[Impressionism|Impressionist]] painter.
== Biography == His father was a customs officer who was transferred to Hamburg while Ludwig was still a small child.<ref>[http://www.flensburg-online.de/strassen/ludwig-dettmann-strasse.html Biographical notes] @ Flensburg online.</ref> After some studies at a local arts and crafts school, he transferred to the [[Prussian Academy of Arts]], where he studied with [[Eugen Bracht]] and [[Franz Skarbina]]. He originally worked as an illustrator.<ref name="K">[http://www.kant.uni-mainz.de/ikonographie/Ikont.PDF/T004.pdf Biographies of Kunstakademie Konigsberg Directors] @ Kant-Forschungsstelle.</ref>
After 1891, he was a teacher at the drawing and painting school of the "{{ill|Association of Berlin Women Artists|de|Verein der Berliner Künstlerinnen}}".<ref>[http://www.vdbk1867.de/geschichte/zeichenschule.html Verein der Berliner Künstler] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150717194255/http://www.vdbk1867.de/geschichte/zeichenschule.html |date=2015-07-17 }} Brief history of the school.</ref> In 1894, he won a small gold medal at the "{{ill|Great Berlin Art Exhibition|de|Große Berliner Kunstausstellung}}", a major annual event that ran from 1893 to 1969. (He would win a large gold medal there in 1909).
Under the influence of [[Max Liebermann]], he turned to landscape painting in oils and watercolors. His first major project consisted of four murals at the town hall in [[Altona, Hamburg|Altona]], depicting the city's history.<ref name="K" />
In 1898, he was one of the founders of the [[Berlin Secession]] and, together with Max Liebermann, [[Walter Leistikow]], {{ill|Otto Heinrich Engel|de}}, [[Oskar Frenzel]], [[Curt Herrmann]] and [[Fritz Klimsch]], was a member of the advisory board. In 1900, he was appointed Director of the [[Kunstakademie Konigsberg]]. He also belonged to the committee charged with selecting artists for the popular [[trading card]]s in [[Stollwerck]] chocolates. [[File:Dettmann-Battle.jpg|thumb|left|265px|Battle Scene]] In 1915, he organized the Army and Marine exhibition, composed of heroic war and battle scenes. It was shown at the Berlin Academy and at the Königsberger Art Association the following year. He contributed portraits of Generals [[Erich Ludendorff]] and [[Paul von Hindenburg]]. For the remainder of the war, he was an official [[war artist]].<ref name="K" />
After the war, he returned to Berlin. In 1923, he illustrated both volumes of ''Weltbrand – Deutschlands Tragödie 1914–1918'' (Conflagration, Germany's Tragedy), a detailed examination of the war and its aftermath by the novelist {{ill|Walter Bloem|de}}, an ardent nationalist.
After Hitler seized power, Dettmann joined the [[Nazi Party]] and served on the board of the "{{ill|Reichsverband bildender Künstler Deutschlands|de}}" (Reich Association of Visual Artists). He would remain a party member until his death. In 1935, he was awarded the "[[Goethe-Medaille für Kunst und Wissenschaft]]" and was chairman of the "{{ill|Association of Berlin Artists|de|Verein Berliner Kunstler}}" for the year 1936-37.<ref name="K" />
In 1938 he wrote ''Ostfront. Ein Denkmal des Deutschen Kampfes'' (Eastern Front, a Monument to the German Struggle). Shortly before his death in 1944, his name was added to the [[Gottbegnadeten list]] of artists crucial to Nazi culture. In 1946, ''Ostfront'' was placed on the "Liste der auszusondernden Literatur" ("weeded-out" literature), a list of Nazi works that were forbidden in the [[Soviet occupation zone]].<ref>[http://www.polunbi.de/bibliothek/1946-nslit-d.html List of forbidden works] @ Polunbi-Katalog.</ref>
==Selected paintings== <center><gallery widths="155" heights="120"> 1897 Dettmann Bei den Wasserrosen im Moor anagoria.JPG|By the Waterlilies in the Moor Ludwig Dettmann Garten mit Stuhl.jpg|Garden with Chair Dettmann-Wave.jpg|Wave File:Ludwig Dettmann - Outono da vida.jpg|The Autumn of Life </gallery></center>
==References== {{reflist}}
== Further reading == * Robert C. Kunath: "War and Art: Nationalist Ideology, Academic Artists, and the Interpretation of the Visual Arts in Imperial Germany, 1914-1918." PhD diss, Stanford University, 1993. * Monika Potztal: ''Ludwig Dettmann 1865–1944. Zwischen Avantgarde und Anpassung.'' Boyens, Heide 2008 {{ISBN|978-3-8042-1249-7}} * Dagmar Jestrzemski: ''Ludwig Dettmann Gemälde im Altonaer Rathaus'' ConferencePoint Verlag Hamburg 2011 {{ISBN|978-3-936406-35-1}} * Robert C. Kunath: "German Art and The Spirit of 1914: Identity, Modernism, and the Case of Ludwig Dettmann," in [[Deborah Ascher Barnstone]] and Thomas O. Haakenson (eds), ''Representations of German Identity''. German Visual Culture vol. 1. New York: Peter Lang, 2012 {{ISBN|978-3034308410}}
== External links == {{Commonscat|Ludwig Dettmann}} * [http://www.artnet.com/artists/ludwig-julius-christian-dettmann/past-auction-results ArtNet: More works by Dettmann.] * [https://books.google.com/books?id=y6nRAAAAMAAJ&pg=PA197&source=gbs_toc_r&cad=3#v=onepage&q&f=false Volume One of ''Weltbrand''] @ Google Books * [http://schaeferkultur.blogspot.com/2008/05/ludwig-dettmann.html Brief biography] @ Bei K.A.T.I. - Kultur und mehr... (blog) * {{LBMV PPN|337437688}} * {{DNB-Portal|116086483}}
{{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dettmann, Ludwig}}

revision.comment: Mark Vonnegut has another child named Zachary Vonnegut.
revision.text:
{{multiple issues| {{BLP sources|date=January 2015}} {{third-party|date=January 2015}} }} {{Infobox writer | name = Mark Vonnegut | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | pseudonym = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1947|5|11}} | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | resting_place = | occupation = [[Pediatrician]], [[memoirist]] | language = | nationality = American | ethnicity = | citizenship = | education = | alma_mater = [[Swarthmore College]], (1969)
[[Harvard Medical School]] | period = | genre = [[Memoir]] | subject = | movement = | notableworks = [[The Eden Express]], [[Just Like Mental Illness Only More So]] | spouse = [[Barbara Vonnegut]] | partner = | children = [[Mark Oliver Vonnegut]],[[Zachary Vonnegut]] | relatives = [[Kurt Vonnegut|Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.]], [[Edith Vonnegut]] | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | module = | website = | portaldisp = }} {{Use mdy dates|date=October 2018}} '''Mark Vonnegut''' (born May 11, 1947) is an American [[pediatrician]] and [[memoir]]ist. He is the son of writer [[Kurt Vonnegut|Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.]] and his first wife, Jane Cox. He is the brother of [[Edith Vonnegut]] and Nanette Vonnegut. He described himself in the preface to his 1975 book as "a [[hippie]], son of a [[counterculture]] hero, BA in religion, (with a) [[genetics|genetic]] disposition to [[schizophrenia]]."Vonnegut, Mark (1975). ''[[The Eden Express|The Eden Express: A Memoir of Insanity]].'' {{ISBN|1-58322-543-9}}.{{rp|preface}} Mark Vonnegut (whom his parents named after [[Mark Twain]]{{citation |title=The Necessary Miracle |magazine=[[The Nation]] |last=Vonnegut |first=Kurt |url=http://www.thenation.com/article/necessary-miracle |date=July 7, 1979 |accessdate=December 6, 2010}}.) graduated from [[Swarthmore College]] in 1969. He briefly worked at Duthie Books and was also briefly chief of a 20-man detachment of special state police that provided the security for Boston State Hospital. During the [[Vietnam War]], he filed an application with the draft board to be considered a [[conscientious objector]], which was denied. After taking the [[psychological examination]], he was given a [[psychiatric]] 4F classification and avoided [[conscription]] into the U.S. military.{{page needed|date=November 2011}} During his undergraduate years, he set out to become a [[Unitarianism|Unitarian]] [[Minister (Christianity)|minister]]. He eventually abandoned that goal.Vonnegut, Mark (2010). ''Just Like Someone Without Mental Illness Only More So.'' [[Delacorte Press]]. {{ISBN|978-0-385-34379-4}}.{{rp|33}} He is the author of ''[[The Eden Express]]'' (1975), which describes his trip to [[British Columbia]] to set up a [[commune (intentional community)|commune]] with his friends and his personal experiences with schizophrenia,https://www.bostonglobe.com/arts/2014/10/06/celebration-vonnegut-cape/RUegb0NmUXBmi449E5TbJI/story.html which at that time he attributed to stress, diet and in part, drug use. During this period, he lived mainly at the commune at [[Powell Lake]], located 18 kilometers by boat from the nearest road or electricity. The book is widely cited as useful for those coping with schizophrenia. He married in 1975.http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20065819,00.html He had a son, Eli James Vonnegut (b. 1980).[https://www.nytimes.com/2004/05/09/style/weddings-celebrations-lydon-friedrich-eli-vonnegut.html?_r=0 ''WEDDINGS/CELEBRATIONS; Lydon Friedrich, Eli Vonnegut'']http://voters.findthedata.com/d/b/Eli-Vonnegut{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} On February 14, 1971, he was diagnosed with severe schizophrenia and committed to Hollywood Hospital in [[Vancouver]].{{rp|37}} Standard [[psychotherapy]] did not help him, and most of his doctors said his case was hopeless. Vonnegut first attributed his recovery to [[orthomolecular]] [[megavitamin therapy]] and then wrote ''The Eden Express''. However, it should be pointed out that in this book, he states that "approximately a third - improve without any treatment. Whatever shrink happens to be standing around when such remissions occur is usually willing to assume credit" pg. 267. From the book, one can see that he was trying to decide if it is the therapy or the ever changing medications that are the most effective for treatment. Vonnegut does not presently attribute his recovery to vitamins. In reality, such situations take years of trial and error treatment to figure out what actually is effective treatment since the diagnostic tools are based on statistics (a group of symptoms and how long they last and what is the age of the patient), making them inherently weak on predictability. This is made worse given the short duration of any treatment because of the prohibitive costs of longer term productive treatment. He subsequently studied medicine at [[Harvard Medical School]] and later came to the conclusion that he actually had [[bipolar disorder]].Vonnegut, Mark. [https://web.archive.org/web/20100218065648/http://www.namimass.org/conv2003/mvspeaks.htm Mark Vonnegut Speaks at Convention], ''NAMI'', May 17, 2003. archived version, February 18, 2010. Dr. Vonnegut, despite odds against him, graduated from Harvard Medical School in 1979. After graduation, Dr. Vonnegut completed a pediatric Internship and Residency at Massachusetts General Hospital. Dr. Vonnegut published an article in The New England Journal of Medicine December 27, 2007 and has published several short pieces on pediatrics and other topics in The Boston Globe and The Patriot Ledger. He has served on the National Institute for Health Consensus Conference on ADHD since November 1999. Dr. Vonnegut wrote The Eden Express which was first published in 1975 and re-published in 2002. His new book, ''Just Like Someone Without Mental Illness Only More So'', was published October 5, 2010. He has practiced pediatrics for over 30 years, opening his own practice, M.V. Pediatrics, in 2001. Dr. Vonnegut respects the parents’ right to choose what is best for their children, and will support parents' decisions. His practice discourages psychiatric medication use in children, and instead offers therapy via social workers, reiki, yoga, and acupuncture. He is currently a [[pediatrician]] in [[Quincy, Massachusetts]].Vonnegut, Mark. [http://www.gotomvpeds.com/about/a-few-thoughts-from-dr-vonnegut "A Few Thoughts From Dr. Vonnegut".], Accessed online, December 4, 2010. Vonnegut published his second book, ''Just Like Someone Without Mental Illness Only More So'', in 2010.https://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=130537541 Like ''The Eden Express'', it is autobiographical.http://www.smithmag.net/memoirville/2010/10/19/interview-mark-vonnegut-md-author-of-just-like-someone-without-mental-illness-only-more-so/ ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.boston.com/news/globe/editorial_opinion/oped/articles/2005/12/27/twisting_vonneguts_views_on_terrorism/ Twisting Vonnegut's views on terrorism] by Mark Vonnegut, ''[[The Boston Globe]]'', December 27, 2005 * [https://web.archive.org/web/20080510180014/http://www.theyoungturks.com/story/2008/4/3/195810/9061/tytvideoclips/Son-of-Kurt-Vonnegut-talks-about-his-Father Mark Vonnegut's interview with The Young Turks] * [http://www.riverfronttimes.com/2008-11-26/culture/the-titan-of-sirens-mark-vonnegut-talks-about-his-legendary-dad-kurt-vonnegut-jr-mdash-and-his-own-love-for-dizzy-dean/ "Mark Vonnegut talks about his legendary dad Kurt Vonnegut, Jr."], ''[[Riverfront Times]]'', November 2008 {{Kurt Vonnegut|state=collapsed}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Vonnegut, Mark}} [[Category:Vonnegut family]] [[Category:Swarthmore College alumni]] [[Category:Harvard Medical School alumni]] [[Category:American pediatricians]] [[Category:Place of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:People with schizophrenia]] [[Category:1947 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American male writers]]

{{Infobox person | name = Mauro Cabral Grinspan | image = <!-- just the filename, without the File: or Image: prefix or enclosing [[brackets]] --> | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = [[Córdoba, Argentina]] | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = | residence = | education = | other_names = | occupation = | known_for = [[Transgender rights|Trans]] and [[Intersex human rights|intersex]] activist and educator | television = | website = {{URL|transactivists.org}} }} '''Mauro Cabral Grinspan''',<ref>{{cite web | work = Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights | url = http://www.ohchr.org/EN/HRBodies/SP/Pages/HRC33.aspx | title = APPOINTMENTS TO BE MADE AT THE 33RD SESSION OF THE HUMAN RIGHTS COUNCIL (13 – 30 September 2016) | date = 2016}}</ref> also known as '''Mauro Cabral''', is an Argentinian [[intersex]] and [[transgender|trans]] activist, who serves as the executive director of [[Global Action for Trans* Equality]] (GATE). A signatory of the [[Yogyakarta Principles]],<ref name="yog">{{cite web |url=http://www.yogyakartaprinciples.org/principles_en_principles.htm |title=The Yogyakarta Principles on the Application of International Human Rights Law in relation to Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= |website=[[Yogyakarta Principles]] |publisher= |access-date=2015-08-01 |quote= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150628071304/http://www.yogyakartaprinciples.org/principles_en_principles.htm |archivedate=2015-06-28 |df= }}</ref> his work focuses on the reform of medical protocols and law reform. In July 2015, Cabral received the inaugural [[Bob Hepple]] Equality Award.<ref name="lsg">{{cite web |url=http://www.lawgazette.co.uk/news/mandela-lawyer-award-winner-announced/5050164.article |title= Mandela lawyer award winner announced |last1=[[Law Society Gazette]] |first1= |last2= |first2= |date=July 2015 |website= |publisher=[[Law Society Gazette]] |access-date=2015-08-01 |quote=}}</ref>
== Early life and perspectives ==
Mauro Cabral Grinspan was assigned female at birth, but now lives as male. He has described how his body was discovered to be different or "incomplete" in his teens; after two surgeries he had to undergo several years of invasive procedures.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=59RwM0koP-M |title= Situación de Derechos Humanos de Personas Intersex: clips de audiencias|last1=Comisión Interamericana de Derechos Humanos |first1= |last2= |first2= |date=2015 |website= YouTube |publisher=Comisión Interamericana de Derechos Humanos |access-date=2015-06-25 |quote=}}</ref>
Cabral Grinspan describes how homophobia is a driving force in the normalization of intersex children, and how surgeries send a message to children that their bodies have to be changed to be acceptable. Cabral Grinspan defines the social challenge of intersex histories as a need to be open to the experience of body diversity without the need to medicalise that experience.<ref name="interdic">{{Cite book| publisher = Mulabi| isbn = 978-987-05-5898-9| editor1-last = Cabral| editor1-first = Mauro| title = Interdicciones: Escrituras de la intersexualidad en castellano| location = Córdoba, Argentina| date = February 2009}}</ref>
== Activism ==
Mauro Cabral Grinspan has been involved in activism on trans and intersex issues since at least 2005. From 2005 to 2007 he was in charge of coordinating the Trans and Intersex Area at the [[International Gay and Lesbian Human Rights Commission|IGLHRC]] Latin American Office.<ref name="sobre" /> He then worked for three years at [http://mulabi.org MULABI, Latin American Space for Sexualities and Rights], becoming Executive Director in 2009. Cabral became a co-director of [[Global Action for Trans Equality]] in January 2010 <ref name="sobre">{{cite web | url = http://transactivists.org/about/ | title = About GATE | work = [[Global Action for Trans Equality]] | accessdate = 31 December 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://iglhrc.org/content/latin-america-iglhrc´s-latin-america-and-caribbean-2005-work | title = Latin America: IGLHRC´s Latin America and the Caribbean 2005 work | work = [[International Gay and Lesbian Human Rights Commission|IGLHRC]] | date = January 4, 2006}}</ref> and also co-chairs the International Trans* Reference Group at the Global Forum on MSM and HIV/AIDS. Cabral is a member of the Latin American Consortium on Intersex Issues, and of the International Advisory Board at the Human Rights Watch LGTB Program.
Cabral Grinspan participated in actions that led to the approval of a ground-breaking law on gender identity by the Argentinian Senate in April 2012. The law makes it possible to change sex designation without undergoing surgical or clinical treatment, or judicial approval.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://100porciento.wordpress.com/2012/04/17/100-diversidad-y-derechos-primer-paso-en-el-senado-de-la-nacion-hacia-la-ley-de-identidad-de-genero/ | title = Primer paso en el Senado de la Nación hacia la Ley de Identidad de Género | work = 100% Diversidad y Derechos | date = April 17, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.pagina12.com.ar/diario/suplementos/soy/1-2103-2011-08-26.html | title = Un día para recordar | work = [[Página/12]] | date = 26 August 2011}}</ref>
Cabral Grinspan has co-ordinated work on reform of the [[World Health Organization]]'s [[International Classification of Diseases]], in particular a critique and alternative proposals in relation to "Gender Incongruence of Childhood".<ref name="icd">{{Cite web|last1=Cabral |first1=Mauro |url=http://globaltransaction.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/critique-and-alternative-proposal-to-the-_gender-incongruence-of-childhood_-category-in-icd-11.pdf |publisher=[[Global Action for Trans Equality]] |title=Critique and Alternative Proposal to the "Gender Incongruence of Childhood" Category in ICD-11 |accessdate=2014-12-26}}</ref> He is a contributor to the [[World Health Organization]] report "Sexual health, human rights and the law".<ref name="who2015">{{Cite book| publisher = World Health Organization| isbn = 9789241564984| last = World Health Organization| title = Sexual health, human rights and the law| location = Geneva| date = June 2015| url = http://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/10665/175556/1/9789241564984_eng.pdf?ua=1}}</ref>
Cabral Grinspan helped organise the third [[International Intersex Forum]] in Malta, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ilga-europe.org/home/news/latest/3rd_intersex_forum_2013 |title=3rd International Intersex Forum in Malta |work=[[ILGA-Europe]] |date=22 July 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131226222209/http://www.ilga-europe.org/home/news/latest/3rd_intersex_forum_2013 |archivedate=26 December 2013 |df= }}</ref> In 2015, Cabral became the senior advisor for a first philanthropic Intersex Human Rights Fund established by the [[Astraea Lesbian Foundation for Justice]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.astraeafoundation.org/news/344/60/Introducing-the-Intersex-Fund-team-at-Astraea |title=Introducing the Intersex Fund team at Astraea! |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=June 16, 2015 |website=[[Astraea Lesbian Foundation for Justice]] |publisher=Astraea Lesbian Foundation for Justice |access-date=2015-07-02 |quote= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150703205803/http://www.astraeafoundation.org/news/344/60/Introducing-the-Intersex-Fund-team-at-Astraea |archivedate=July 3, 2015 |df= }}</ref>
In 2006 Cabral participated in the production of the [[Yogyakarta Principles]] on the Application of Human Rights Legislation to Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.infojusnoticias.gov.ar/nacionales/yogyakarta-la-identidad-de-genero-desde-la-perspectiva-de-los-derechos-humanos-5397.html |title=Yogyakarta: la identidad de género desde la perspectiva de los derechos humanos |last1=Infojus Noticias |first1= |last2= |first2= |date=August 26, 2014 |website= |publisher=Ministerio de Justicia y Derechos Humanos, Argentina |access-date=2015-06-25 |quote=}}</ref> and was one of the initial 29 signatories.<ref name="yog" /> He is also a drafting committee member and signatory of the Yogyakarta Principles plus 10, on the application of international human rights law in relation to sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression and sex characteristics.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.yogyakartaprinciples.org/principles-en/yp10/ | title = Yogyakarta Principles plus 10| archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20171201043532/http://www.yogyakartaprinciples.org/principles-en/yp10/ | archive-date=2017-12-01}}</ref>
== Academic career ==
Cabral Grinspan has a Degree in History from the [[National University of Córdoba]] <ref name="akahata">{{cite web |url= http://www.akahataorg.org/organización/integrantes/ |title=Integrantes |last1=AKAHATÁ |first1= |last2= |first2= |date=2015 |website= |publisher= AKAHATÁ |access-date=2015-06-25 |quote=}}</ref>
==Selected bibliography==
===Books=== * {{Cite book| publisher = Mulabi| isbn = 978-987-05-5898-9| editor1-last = Cabral| editor1-first = Mauro| title = Interdicciones: Escrituras de la intersexualidad en castellano| location = Córdoba, Argentina| date = February 2009}}
===Journals=== * {{Cite journal| doi = 10.1016/S2215-0366(16)30043-8| issn = 2215-0366| volume = 3| issue = 5| pages = 405–406| last1 = Cabral| first1 = Mauro| last2 = Suess| first2 = Amets| last3 = Ehrt| first3 = Julia| last4 = Seehole| first4 = Tshegofatso Joshua| last5 = Wong| first5 = Joe| title = Removal of gender incongruence of childhood diagnostic category: a human rights perspective| journal = [[The Lancet]] Psychiatry| accessdate = 2016-05-16| date = May 2016| url = http://linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S2215036616300438}} * {{Cite journal| doi = 10.1016/j.rhm.2015.11.014| issn = 0968-8080 | volume = 23| issue = 46| pages = 196| last1 = Cabral| first1 = Mauro| last2 = Eisfeld| first2 = Justus| title = Statement from GATE - Global Action for Trans* Equality| journal = [[Reproductive Health Matters]] | accessdate = 2016-05-16| date = November 1, 2015| url = http://www.rhm-elsevier.com/article/S0968808015000919/abstract}} * {{Cite journal| volume = 3| issue = 8| pages = 199–212| last = Cabral| first = Mauro| title = Tercera posición en materia de género| journal = Derechos Humanos| date = December 2014| url = http://www.infojus.gob.ar/docs-f/ediciones/revistas/DERECHOS_HUMANOS_A3_N8.pdf}} * {{Cite journal| doi = 10.1215/23289252-2685669| issn = 2328-9252 | volume = 1| issue = 3| pages = 419–439| last1 = Boellstorff| first1 = T.| last2 = Cabral| first2 = M.| last3 = Cardenas| first3 = M.| last4 = Cotten| first4 = T.| last5 = Stanley| first5 = E. A.| last6 = Young| first6 = K.| last7 = Aizura| first7 = A. Z.| title = Decolonizing Transgender: A Roundtable Discussion| journal = TSQ: Transgender Studies Quarterly| accessdate = 2016-05-20| date = January 2014 | url = http://tsq.dukejournals.org/cgi/doi/10.1215/23289252-2685669}}
===Editorials===
* {{Cite web| last = Cabral | first = Mauro| url = https://transactivists.org/2016/10/26/iad2016-a-message-from-mauro-cabral/ | title = IAD2016: A Message from Mauro Cabral | work = [[Global Action for Trans* Equality]] | date = October 26, 2016 | accessdate = 2016-10-27}} * {{Cite web | publisher = [[Intersex Awareness Day|Intersex Day]]| last = Cabral Grinspan | first = Mauro| title = The marks on our bodies| date = October 25, 2015 | url = http://intersexday.org/en/mauro-cabral-marks-bodies/ | access-date = 2016-05-16}} * {{Cite web| editor1-last = Cabral| editor1-first = Mauro| editor2-last = Carpenter| editor2-first = Morgan| editor2-link = Morgan Carpenter | title = Intersex Issues in the International Classification of Diseases: a revision| date = 2014| url = http://intersexday.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/intersex_issues_in_the_international_classification_of_diseases-cabral-carpenter-2014.pdf | accessdate = 2016-05-20}} * {{Cite web| publisher = Global Action for Trans* Equality| last = Cabral | first = Mauro | title = Critique and Alternative Proposal to the "Gender Incongruence of Childhood" Category in ICD-11| date = April 2013 | url = http://globaltransaction.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/critique-and-alternative-proposal-to-the-_gender-incongruence-of-childhood_-category-in-icd-11.pdf}} * {{Cite web| last1 = Maffia| first1 = Diana| last2 = Cabral| first2 = Mauro| title = Los sexos ¿son o se hacen?| location = Buenos Aires| date = 2013| url = https://programaddssrr.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/los-sexos-son-o-se-hacen.pdf}}
===Speeches===
* In September 2016, Cabral gave a keynote presentation at the 2016 Trans*studies conference at the [[University of Arizona]].<ref>{{cite web | url = https://lgbt.arizona.edu/2016-Trans-studies | title = 2016 Trans*studies | work = Institute for Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Studies, [[University of Arizona]] | date = 2016}}</ref> * The "first [[United Nations]] [[Human Rights Council]] side event on intersex issues" in March 2014, alongside representatives of [[Intersex UK]], [[Organisation Intersex International Australia]], and [[Zwischengeschlecht]],<ref>{{Cite web|last1=Cabral |first1=Mauro |url=http://oii.org.au/25644/intersex-side-event-un-human-rights-council/ |title=Intersex side event at the UN Human Rights Council |publisher=[[Organisation Intersex International Australia]] |accessdate=2014-12-29 }}</ref> * In March 2013, Mauro Cabral, together with [[Natasha Jiménez]] of [http://mulabi.org MULABI], Paula Sandrine Marchado and [[Pidgeon Pagonis]] testified to the [[Inter-American Commission on Human Rights]] on ''Situation of Human Rights of Intersex Persons in the Americas''. The first hearing on intersex human rights before the Commission, each shared their personal experiences and presented broader issues, such as "normalization" surgery on the genitals of intersex infants.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://hrbrief.org/2013/03/situation-of-human-rights-of-intersex-persons-in-the-americas/ | title = Situation of Human Rights of Intersex Persons in the Americas | work = Center for Human Rights and Humanitarian Law | date = March 21, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.oas.org/en/iachr/media_center/PReleases/2013/Calendar147eng.pdf | title = Schedule of Hearings 147o Session Inter-American Commission on Human Rights (IACHR) | work = [[Organization of American States]] | date = 2013}}</ref> * On 30 June 2011, Mauro Cabral, gave a speech at the [[European Parliament Subcommittee on Human Rights]] on trans and intersex rights.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://vimeo.com/26002162 |title=Mauro Cabral: Trans and intersex rights |publisher=[[European Parliament]] LGBT Intergroup at [[Vimeo.com]]|date=5 July 2011 |accessdate=25 April 2012}}</ref>
Cabral has contributed to numerous documents including the Yogyakarta Principles, the World Health Organization report "Sexual health, human rights and the law",<ref name="who2015" /> and the [[Open Society Foundations]] report "Licence to Be Yourself".<ref>{{Cite book| publisher = Open Society Foundations| isbn = 9781940983103| last1 = Byrne| first1 = Jack| last2 = Open Society Institute, Open Society Foundation, [[Open Society Foundations]]| last3 = Public Health Program (Open Society Institute)| first3 = Open Society Public Health Program| title = License to Be Yourself Laws and Advocacy for Legal Gender Recognition of Trans People| location = New York| accessdate = 2014-10-23| date = 2014| url = http://www.opensocietyfoundations.org/reports/license-be-yourself}}</ref>
== Awards and recognition ==
In July 2015, Cabral was a co-recipient of the inaugural Bob Hepple Equality Award, alongside Pragna Patel of [[Southall Black Sisters]].<ref name="ohrh">{{cite web |url=http://ohrh.law.ox.ac.uk/the-inaugural-bob-hepple-equality-award-celebrates-equal-rights-activists-and-advances-support-to-their-cause/ |title=The Inaugural Bob Hepple Equality Award Celebrates Equal Rights Activists and Advances Support to their Cause |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=July 21, 2015 |website= |publisher=[[Oxford Human Rights Hub]] |access-date=2015-08-01 |quote=}}</ref> The award is named for [[Bob Hepple]], the former lawyer of [[Nelson Mandela]].<ref name="lsg" /> The [[Oxford Human Rights Hub]] comments, "Cabral was crucial in the process leading to the enactment of Argentina's Gender Identity Law in 2012, a law which has been extensively cited in court decisions on gender identity cases, including the Indian Supreme Court, and which has inspired legislation reform in countries including Malta, the Netherlands and Sweden."<ref name="ohrh" />

{{Infobox comics character |image=MisterHyde.png |caption=Cover of ''[[The Amazing Spider-Man]]'' #232.
Art by [[John Romita, Jr.]] |character_name=Mister Hyde |real_name=Calvin Zabo |publisher=[[Marvel Comics]] |debut=''[[Journey into Mystery]]'' #99 (December 1963) |creators=[[Stan Lee]] (Writer)
[[Don Heck]] (Artist) |alliances=[[Masters of Evil]]
[[Lethal Legion]]
[[Thunderbolts (comics)|Thunderbolts]] |partners=[[Cobra (Marvel Comics)|Cobra]]
[[Jester (Marvel Comics)#Jonathan Powers|Jester]]
[[Mac Gargan|Scorpion]]
[[Batroc the Leaper|Batroc]] |aliases= Thor |powers='''As Calvin Zabo''':
Brilliant medical researcher
Genius-level intellect
Extensive knowledge of biochemistry
'''As Mr. Hyde''':
Superhuman strength, stamina, durability and resistance to injury }} '''Mister Hyde''' ('''Calvin Zabo''') is a [[fictional character]], a [[supervillain]] appearing in [[American comic book]]s published by [[Marvel Comics]]. He is the father of [[Daisy Johnson]]. Calvin Zabo appears in the television series ''[[Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.]]'', which is set in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]], portrayed by [[Kyle MacLachlan]]. ==Publication history== Mister Hyde first appeared in ''[[Journey into Mystery]]'' #99 and was created by [[Stan Lee]] and [[Don Heck]]. Mister Hyde is based upon the [[Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde (character)|literary character]] by [[Robert Louis Stevenson]].{{Citation needed|date=November 2010}} He has appeared as a regular character in ''Thunderbolts'' since issue #157, and remained with the team after the title transitioned into ''Dark Avengers'' beginning with issue #175. ==Fictional character biography== Calvin Zabo was born in [[Trenton, New Jersey]]. He was a morally abject but brilliant [[biochemist]] who was fascinated by the effect of hormones on human physiology. One of his favorite stories was [[Robert Louis Stevenson|Stevenson]]'s 1886 classic, ''[[Strange Case of Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde]]''. He was convinced that the experiment [[Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde (character)|Dr. Jekyll]] performed in the story could actually be accomplished, and became obsessed with the idea of unleashing his full bestial nature in a superhuman form. However, he needed money to do this, so he robbed his various employers systematically. Though too intelligent to be caught, the medical community was suspicious of his tendency to always be employed by organizations which were subsequently robbed. Zabo eventually sought work as a [[surgeon]] in a hospital where [[Thor (Marvel Comics)|Donald Blake]] was a directing [[physician]], yet Blake would not allow him a job due to his history. Zabo was enraged that Blake would not give him the position, even though he did indeed intend to rob the organization, and swore revenge. He was eventually successful in creating his formula and turned into a huge, [[Hulk (comics)|Hulk]]-like creature he called "Mister Hyde," named after the character in the novel. In this new form, he found he had superhuman strength enabling him to crush cars and tear through steel as though it were made of cardboard. With his new superhuman powers he sought out Blake, whom he tried to kill by throwing him from a window, but Blake transformed into Thor by striking his cane on the wall and survived, claiming he had saved Blake. Hyde, hearing of this on the radio, decided to eliminate Thor, and tried to frame him for a bank robbery by using his superhuman strength to tear open a bank vault while disguised as Thor. While Donald and Jane were out, Mister Hyde met and kidnapped them at gunpoint. As Don Blake, Thor was tied up next to a bomb that would explode in 24 hours unless Mr. Hyde defused it. However, when attempting to steal a Polaris submarine to roam the seas like a pirate, Hyde was defeated and the authorities, seeing his superhuman strength, realized he must have impersonated Thor, but Thor was forced to allow him to escape, as Jane Foster thought Blake was still in danger.''Journey into Mystery'' #99-100 Hyde went into business as a full-time professional super-criminal and partnered himself with the [[Cobra (Marvel Comics)|Cobra]] to get revenge upon Thor, but they were both defeated despite getting Thor's hammer from him briefly.''Journey into Mystery'' #105-106 With the Cobra, he was bailed out and employed by [[Loki (comics)|Loki]] to kidnap [[Jane Foster (comics)|Jane Foster]], and they battled Thor again. Loki doubled their powers to try to help them. Loki showed Thor where Jane Foster was being held. The house had many traps set up for Thor, and Jane Foster was almost killed in an explosion. Thor was able to defeat both villains, and Mister Hyde was caught by a ray which paralyzed him. Both Hyde and Cobra were jailed, and Jane's life was saved by an Asgardian formula [[Balder (comics)|Balder]] sent to Thor.''Journey into Mystery'' #110-111 Hyde and the Cobra escaped prison, but were eventually recaptured by [[Daredevil (Marvel Comics character)|Daredevil]].''Daredevil'' #30-32 They teamed with the [[Jester (Marvel Comics)#Jonathan Powers|Jester]] to get revenge, but were defeated again.''Daredevil'' #61 With the [[Mac Gargan|Scorpion]], Hyde then battled [[Captain America]] and the [[Falcon (comics)|Falcon]].''Captain America'' #151-152 Teaming with the Cobra again, Hyde attempted to acquire Cagliostro's serum.''Daredevil'' #142-143 While serving in prison following this failed attempt, Hyde was ensnared by the mind-control power of the [[Purple Man]], and forced to battle Daredevil in an arena alongside Cobra, the Jester, and the [[Gladiator (Melvin Potter)|Gladiator]].''Daredevil'' #153-154 Tiring of their repeated failures, the Cobra elected to sever their partnership when he escaped from Ryker's Island, taking the time to taunt Hyde before leaving.''Spectacular Spider-Man'' #46 Hyde has never forgiven him for the slight. With [[Batroc the Leaper|Batroc]], Hyde later blackmailed New York City with a hijacked supertanker and attempted to destroy the entire city in order to kill Cobra. Eventually, he was defeated by Captain America with Batroc's aid.''Captain America'' #251-252 Hyde again stalked Cobra seeking revenge, and this time battled [[Spider-Man]].''Amazing Spider-Man'' #231-232 He was imprisoned again, but escaped Ryker's Island and battled Spider-Man and the [[Black Cat (Marvel Comics)|Black Cat]] during another attempt at Cobra's life.''Spectacular Spider-Man'' #88 Hyde later battled Daredevil again.''Daredevil'' #235 Hyde later became a member of [[Helmut Zemo|Baron Helmut Zemo]]'s incarnation of the [[Masters of Evil]] and invaded [[Avengers Mansion]] along with them, torturing the [[Black Knight (Dane Whitman)|Black Knight]] and [[Edwin Jarvis]]. With [[Erik Josten|Goliath]] and the [[Wrecking Crew (comics)|Wrecking Crew]], he nearly killed [[Hercules (Marvel Comics)|Hercules]], but was defeated by the [[Avengers (comics)|Avengers]].''Avengers'' #273-276 Mister Hyde later attempted an escape from the [[Vault (comics)|Vault]] alongside [[Mary MacPherran|Titania]], [[Vibro (comics)|Vibro]], the [[Griffin (Marvel Comics)|Griffin]], and [[Armadillo (comics)|Armadillo]], but was defeated and recaptured by [[Captain America|The Captain]].''Iron Man'' #228; ''Captain America'' #340 He eventually escaped from the Vault alongside the [[Wizard (Marvel Comics)|Wizard]] and others.''Avengers Spotlight'' #26 Hyde was later defeated in combat by the Cobra.''Captain America'' #365-367 Hyde later fought with the [[Hulk (comics)|Grey Hulk]] and received head trauma that limited his ability to transform.''Incredible Hulk'' #368 He was subsequently caught by the police when he coincidentally checked into the same hotel as the one where the ''[[Daily Bugle]]'' staff were attending [[Robbie Robertson (comics)|Robbie Robertson]]'s retirement party, allowing Peter Parker to defeat him using an improvised costume.''The Amazing Spider-Man'' #433 Shortly after, Hyde had several run-ins with the [[Ghost Rider (Danny Ketch)|Ghost Rider]] in which he was defeated with the [[Ghost Rider (Daniel Ketch)#Powers and abilities|Penance Stare]].''Ghost Rider'' vol. 3 #4 Hyde briefly helped the [[symbiote (comics)|symbiote]]-bonded [[Toxin (comics)|Toxin]] track Cobra after a prison escape by providing a piece of skin for the symbiote to track.''Toxin'' #1 Zabo was being held in The Raft (the Ryker's Island Prison complex) 6 months after the events of ''[[Avengers Disassembled]]''.''Alias'' #26 When a prison break was caused by the villain [[Electro (comics)#Electro (Marvel Comics)|Electro]], Zabo emerged in his Hyde persona, fought with Daredevil, and was knocked unconscious by [[Luke Cage]].''New Avengers'' #1-4 At one point, Zabo was discovered by the [[Young Avengers]] to be selling a derivative of his Hyde formula on the street as one of the various illegal substances known as Mutant Growth Hormone.''Young Avengers'' #7-8 Zabo grafts abilities similar to the powers of Spider-Man to homeless teenagers. After Spider-Man revealed his identity during the ''[[Civil War (comic book)|Civil War]]'' storyline, Zabo sought to recreate the circumstances of Spider-Man's "birth", by taking in orphans off the street, imbuing them with spider-powers, and seeing whether or not the teenagers would give in to their darker impulses. During the ensuing battle with Spider-Man, Hyde pulled webbing off his face, taking his eyelids with it, and was hit in the face with hydrochloric acid, courtesy of one of his own guinea pigs. It is stated by Spider-Man that he has been left blinded and had his face ruined as a result. [[Lizard (comics)|Dr. Curt Connors]] was later seen aiding Spider-Man in a cure for Calvin, one of Zabo's test subjects.''Sensational Spider-Man'' (vol. 2) #35-37 Hyde's daughter is [[Daisy Johnson]], who is a member of [[S.H.I.E.L.D.]]; her mother was apparently a prostitute with whom Calvin Zabo regularly had 'business',''Secret War'' #2 and the girl was put up for adoption after birth. Daisy subsequently manifested superpowers inherited from Zabo's mutated genetic code. The [[Hood (comics)|Hood]] hired him as part of his criminal organization to take advantage of the split in the superhero community caused by the [[Registration acts (comics)#2006 Superhuman Registration Act|Superhuman Registration Act]].''New Avengers'' #35 Later he was seen along with [[Firebrand (Marvel Comics)#Firebrand|Firebrand]], [[Cobra (Marvel Comics)#Klaus Voorhees|King Cobra]], and [[Mauler (comics)|Mauler]], who attacked Yellowjacket, Constrictor and other Initiative staff and trainees.''Avengers: The Initiative'' #13 Mister Hyde worked with [[Boomerang (comics)|Boomerang]], [[Tiger Shark (Marvel Comics)|Tiger Shark]], and [[Whirlwind (comics)|Whirlwind]] to manipulate [[Mac Gargan|Venom]] III into procuring Norman Osborn's fortunes. This was thwarted by Venom and Green Goblin as Norman threw a bomb into Mister Hyde's mouth causing him to spit out blood. Norman Osborn then warned Mister Hyde and the villains that if they cross him again, he will kill everyone that they ever loved before they are tortured to death.''Thunderbolts: Reasons in Madness'' #1 Mister Hyde joins the [[Grim Reaper (comics)|Grim Reaper]]'s new [[Lethal Legion]], claiming embarrassment over Norman blowing up his mouth with a bomb.''Dark Reign: Lethal Legion'' #1 Mister Hyde appears as member of Hood's crime syndicate, during an attack on the [[The New Avengers (comics)|New Avengers]].''New Avengers'' #56 Mister Hyde was selected to be a part of the "beta team" of the [[Thunderbolts (comics)|Thunderbolts]], alongside [[Boomerang (comics)|Boomerang]], [[Shocker (comics)|Shocker]], [[Gunna (comics)|Gunna]] and [[Centurius]].''Thunderbolts'' #156-157 Later, Mister Hyde began a drug operation in California where he came into conflict with [[Ghost Rider (Robbie Reyes)|Robbie Reyes]] after his car had some of Mister Hyde's pills inside. Mister Hyde's mercenaries chase Robbie down during the race in order to retrieve the car and the pills. Robbie is gunned down by the mercenaries when he mistakes them for police, and they torch the scene. Robbie is revived as a demonic being called the [[Ghost Rider (Robbie Reyes)|Ghost Rider]] who sports a flaming helmet-like head. In this form, Robbie drives off in the car, now similarly ablaze. The Ghost Rider defeats a few mercenaries and soon disappears in an explosion.''All-New Ghost Rider'' #1 Robbie eventually fights and defeats Zabo, becoming something of a local hero and urban legend.''All-New Ghost Rider'' #6 Having regrouped and refined his Hyde Formula into new blue pills, Calvin Zabo gradually takes over the L.A. criminal underground with his "Blue Hyde Brigade," which includes Guero and his gang, longtime enemies of Robbie, calling themselves the "Blue Krüe."''All-New Ghost Rider'' #9 During the ''[[Avengers: Standoff!]]'' storyline, Mister Hyde was an inmate of Pleasant Hill, a gated community established by S.H.I.E.L.D.''Avengers Standoff: Assault on Pleasant Hill Alpha'' #1''[[Howling Commandos of S.H.I.E.L.D.]]'' #6 During the "Opening Salvo" part of the ''[[Secret Empire (comics)|Secret Empire]]'' storyline, Mister Hyde is recruited by Baron Helmut Zemo to join the Army of Evil.''Captain America: Steve Rogers'' #16 During Hydra's takeover of the United States, Mister Hyde is one of a few Army of Evil members not in a stasis pod and is shown leading a group of Hydra soldiers to invade New Attilan and capture the Inhumans.''Secret Warriors'' #2 He alongside Hydra's Avengers catch his daughter Daisy and her team, the [[Secret Warriors (2017 series)|Secret Warriors]]. During interrogation, Daisy uses her powers to destroy the Helicarrier they're in, forcing Mister Hyde to retreat.''Secret Warriors'' #3-4 ==Powers and abilities== The process that transforms Dr. Calvin Zabo into his Mr. Hyde persona is a hormonal transformation caused by ingestion of chemical formula.''Sensational Spider-Man (vol. 2)'' #37 As his body adjusted to its new form, Mr. Hyde's strength, stamina, durability, and resistance to physical injury all increase to superhuman levels. Hyde's powers are sufficient to stand toe to toe with the likes of [[Thor (Marvel Comics)|Thor]] and survive. He has been shown tearing apart steel in a bank vault with ease.''Journey into Mystery'' #99 Through further experimental procedures over the years, his strength has been increased beyond its original limits. Mr. Hyde must ingest his special chemical formula periodically to maintain his ability to transform himself from one identity to the other at will; mental fatigue or injury can impair his ability to transform himself into Mr. Hyde. He employs a device that resembles a wristwatch that contains a supply of the formula that he can use to deliver it directly into his bloodstream, enabling him to transform at the push of a button. Due to the nature of the transformation, Hyde's skin is warped. This gives his face a distorted look reminiscent of the [[Lon Chaney, Sr.]] [[The Phantom of the Opera (1925 film)#Makeup|make-up]] used in ''[[The Phantom of the Opera (1925 film)|The Phantom of the Opera]]''. Dr. Calvin Zabo is a brilliant medical research scientist with a Ph.D. in [[Medicine]] and extensive knowledge of [[biochemistry]]. These skills are lost to his Hyde persona. ==Other versions== ===Age of Apocalypse=== In the timeline of the "[[Age of Apocalypse]]" storyline Mr. Hyde (as well as the Cobra) is a near-feral and cannibal "Scavenger". He is known to prowl graveyards and attack anyone entering his territory.''Tales From The Age of Apocalypse'' #2 (December 1997). Marvel Comics ===Elseworlds=== Mr. Hyde appeared in the [[Elseworlds]] ''[[Daredevil/Batman: Eye for an Eye]]'' crossover book. [[Two-Face]] partnered with Mister Hyde for a series of technological robberies. In truth, Two-Face had implanted Hyde's brain with the material needed to "grow" an experimental "organic" computer chip, and fed Hyde pills to keep him enraged. Once grown, the chip would kill Hyde, its current growth also weakening Hyde's strength as his energy is diverted to support the chip (Batman noting during the fight that Hyde should normally have a punch that could knock [[Superman]] into orbit). Hyde berates Two-Face, proud he has abandoned his past as Zabo and insults Two-Face for hanging onto his Harvey Dent side, as well as using a coin to decide between right and wrong. Two-Face is glad the process will kill Hyde. In the end, Daredevil uses his past friendship with Dent to talk Two-Face into supplying the antidote for the chip, which saves Hyde's life.''Daredevil/Batman: Eye for an Eye'' (1997) ===House of M=== {{See also|House of M}} Mister Hyde appears as a member of Hood's Masters of Evil.''House of M: Masters of Evil'' #1 Before the [[S.H.I.E.L.D.#House of M|Red Guard]] attacks Santo Rico, Mister Hyde leaves the team alongside [[Cobra (Marvel Comics)#Klaus Vorhees|Cobra (Klaus Voorhees)]], [[Crossbones (comics)|Crossbones (Brock Rumlow)]], and [[Thunderball (comics)|Thunderball (Eliot Franklin)]].''House of M: Masters of Evil'' #4 Mister Hyde was later seen as an Army scientist.''New Thunderbolts'' #11 ===Marvel Zombies=== A zombified Mister Hyde appears in ''[[Marvel Zombies 4]]''. He is seen attacking the new Midnight Sons, trying to bite one of them, but he is quickly killed by Man-Thing when he rips zombie Mister Hyde apart and holding a huge [[boulder]] and dropping it down on him, crushing the zombie Mister Hyde to death instantly.''Marvel Zombies 4'' #1-4 (June – September 2009) ===Thor: The Mighty Avenger=== Mr. Hyde is the antagonist of the first two issues of this alternate universe retelling of Thor's origin. Thor, confused and partially amnesiac, stops Hyde from hassling an innocent woman. This drives Hyde into an obsession with Thor's new friend, a museum employee named [[Jane Foster (comics)|Jane Foster]].''Thor: The Mighty Avenger'' #1-2 (September 2010) ==In other media== ===Television=== * Mister Hyde appeared in The Mighty Thor portion of ''[[The Marvel Super Heroes]]''.{{cn|date=October 2017}} * Calvin Zabo appears in the television series ''[[Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.]]'' played by [[Kyle MacLachlan]].{{cn|date=October 2017}} The character is initially known as '''The Doctor''' until his first name is revealed in the episode "[[What They Become]]".{{cite web|url=http://screencrush.com/agents-of-shield-season-2-glenn-talbot-adrian-pasdar-kyle-maclachlan-doctor-skye/ |title=Marvel’s ‘Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.’ Season 2: Glenn Talbot Returns, Plus...Kyle MacLachlan? |last=Fitzpatrick |first=Kevin |work=Screen Crush |date=August 7, 2014 |accessdate=August 7, 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Rhia7h2T?url=http://screencrush.com/agents-of-shield-season-2-glenn-talbot-adrian-pasdar-kyle-maclachlan-doctor-skye/ |archivedate=August 9, 2014 |deadurl=no |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://marvel.com/news/tv/23795/debriefing_the_marvels_agents_of_shield_winter_finale |title=Debriefing the Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. Winter Finale |last=Strom |first=Marc |publisher=[[Marvel Comics|Marvel.com]] |date=December 10, 2014 |accessdate=December 17, 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141213091009/http://marvel.com/news/tv/23795/debriefing_the_marvels_agents_of_shield_winter_finale |archivedate=December 13, 2014 |deadurl=no |df= }} The formula he takes is described by Agent Jemma Simmons as being primarily composed of ''anabolic-androgenic steroids, a liver enzyme blocker, various metabolic enhancers, methamphetamines, [[gorilla]] testosterone, and a drop of [[peppermint]]''. However, the formula requires at least one milligram of adrenaline to achieve its full effect.{{cite episode|title=[[S.O.S. (Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.)|S.O.S. Part 2]]|series=Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.|credits=Gierhart, Billy (director); Jed Whedon and Maurissa Tancharoen (writer)|network=[[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]|airdate=May 12, 2015|season=2|number=22}} He is [[Daisy Johnson|Daisy "Skye" Johnson]]'s (portrayed by [[Chloe Bennet]]) father with "'''Johnson'''" being his original last name until he changed it when he went on the run; his wife is the ageless [[Inhumans|Inhuman]] Jiaying (portrayed by [[Dichen Lachman]]), who runs the Inhuman safe haven Afterlife.{{cite episode|title=[[The Frenemy of My Enemy]]|series=Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.|credits=Gaviola, Karen (director); Monica Owusu-Breen (writer)|network=[[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]|airdate=April 21, 2015|season=2|number=18}} In the episode "[[S.O.S. (Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.)|S.O.S]]", Cal uses his formula to rampage on the S.H.I.E.L.D. headquarters before realizing that his wife's war against S.H.I.E.L.D. is a mistake. During the fight against Jiaying, Calvin saves Daisy, both from death and from having to kill her mother in self-defense, by killing his wife. Later on, his memory is altered which allows him to start over with a new identity while working as a veterinarian. In the episode "The Patriot," it is revealed by [[Glenn Talbot]] that Calvin Zabo's formula was modified by scientists working for him in order to give [[Jeffrey Mace]] his super-strength and invulnerability as part of 'Project Patriot'.{{cite episode|title=The Patriot|series=Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.|credits=Tancharoen, Kevin (director); James C. Oliver and Sharla Oliver (writer)|network=[[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]|airdate=January 17, 2017|season=4|number=10}} ===Video games=== * Mister Hyde appears as a boss character in the 1996 video game ''[[Iron Man and X-O Manowar in Heavy Metal]]''. * Mister Hyde is a boss and playable character in ''[[Marvel Avengers Alliance 2]]''.{{cn|date=August 2016}} * Mister Hyde appears in ''[[Marvel Heroes (video game)|Marvel Heroes]]''. He appears as the end boss in the Bronx Zoo One-Shot. During this one-shot, Calvin Zabo is broken out of prison by Lizard so that they can make their way to Lizard's hidden lab as part of Lizard's plot to have Calvin Zabo work on keeping his Curt Connors' side dormant. Once Calvin Zabo becomes Mister Hyde, he injects Lizard with his Hyde serum turning him into a more powerful version of himself as Mister Hyde plans to use his Lizard Serum/Hyde Serum to add to the Bronx Zoo's water supply resulting in lizard-like hybrids like Lizard-Monkeys, Lizard-Bears, Lizard-Bats, Lizard-Giraffes, and Lizard-Sharks. The players are able to fight their way past the lizard-like hybrids and defeat Mister Hyde. Mister Hyde later appears as a boss in Industry City Patrol. * Cal Johnson and Mister Hyde are playable characters in ''[[Lego Marvel's Avengers]]''. They appear as part of the ''[[Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.]]'' DLC.{{cite web|url=http://comicbook.com/2016/03/17/lego-marvels-avengers-season-pass-dlc-revealed/ |title=LEGO Marvel's Avengers Season Pass {{short description|American gun rights activist}} {{other people|Paul Erickson|Paul Erickson (disambiguation)}}
'''Paul Erickson''' (born 1962) is an American [[conservatism in the United States|conservative]] [[political operative]] and lawyer who has been involved in several Republican presidential campaigns.<ref name=nyt>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/12/03/us/politics/trump-putin-russia-nra-campaign.html|title=Operative Offered Trump Campaign ‘Kremlin Connection’ Using N.R.A. Ties|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=December 3, 2017|first=Nicholas|last=Fandos}}</ref> He has strong ties to the [[National Rifle Association]] and Russian interests and, as of 2017, was subject to federal investigation into [[Russian interference in the 2016 United States elections]].<ref name=BuzzFeed2018-07-31>{{cite news|url=https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/jasonleopold/maria-butina-paul-erickson-suspicious-bank-money-russia|title=Here Is The Money Trail From The Russian "Agent" And Her Republican Partner: Federal investigators say some of the money went to Maria Butina’s campaign to help Russia infiltrate American politics|date=July 31, 2018|work=[[BuzzFeed News]]|last1=Leopold|first1=Jason|last2=Cormier|first2=Anthony|access-date=October 15, 2018}}</ref>
== Education == Erickson's hometown is [[Vermillion, South Dakota]].<ref name=rcj/> He attended the [[University of South Dakota]] and then transferred to [[Yale University]], where he graduated with a bachelors degree in economics and political science in 1984. In 1980, while at USD, Erickson coordinated a youth campaign for Representative [[Jim Abdnor]]. For a year between his time at USD and Yale, Erickson served as the national treasurer of the [[College Republicans]] in Washington, D.C., whose staff at the time included [[Grover Norquist]], [[Ralph Reed]], and [[Jack Abramoff]]. Abramoff later wrote, "To every college Republican who contacted the national office, Paul Erickson was by far the most impressive person they had ever encountered in politics."<ref name=rcj/>
Also while in college, Erickson wrote "Fritzbusters", a comedy routine that was critical of Democratic presidential nominee [[Walter Mondale]] which had similarities to the then newly released film ''[[Ghostbusters]]'' (1984).<ref name=fritzbusters>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1984/10/04/us/young-fritzbusters-are-reined-in.html|title=Young Fritzbusters are Reined In|last=Barron|first=James|access-date=March 24, 2018|language=en}}</ref> Erickson and some fellow College Republicans performed Fritzbusters at the [[1984 Republican National Convention]] and later as a warm-up act for [[Ronald Reagan]] at some rallies during the [[United States presidential election, 1984|1984 United States presidential election]].<ref name="rcj" /> The campaign stopped running Fritzbusters after more than 100 students wearing Fritzbusters shirts heckled Mondale in September 1984.<ref name=fritzbusters/> Erickson earned a law degree from the [[University of Virginia School of Law]] in 1988.<ref name=rcj/>
== Political consulting == In addition to his political work while in college, Erickson worked in 1985 as the deputy campaign manager for Richard Viguerie’s unsuccessful campaign for [[Virginia lieutenant governor]].<ref name="rcj" />
Frustrated by the tax increase led by President [[George H. W. Bush|George H.W. Bush]], Erickson served as the national political director / campaign manager for the 1992 presidential campaign of [[Pat Buchanan]].<ref name="rcj" /><ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/1992-03-19/news/mn-5929_1_bush-campaign|title=Buchanan Still at Odds With Bush|newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=March 19, 1992|first=Cathleen|last=Decker}}</ref><ref name=db>{{cite news|url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/the-kremlin-and-gop-have-a-new-friendand-boy-does-she-love-guns|title=The Kremlin and GOP Have a New Friend—and Boy, Does She Love Guns|publisher=[[The Daily Beast]]|date=February 23, 2017|first=Tim|last=Mak}}</ref> A biographer of Buchanan later said Erickson was "the best there was at the price Pat could afford."<ref name="rcj" />
Erickson later served as an advisor to [[Mitt Romney]] for both of his presidential campaigns.<ref name="db" /> He is also a former board member of the [[American Conservative Union]], the group that organizes the [[Conservative Political Action Conference]] (CPAC).<ref name="db" /> He was a friend of [[Andrew Breitbart]].<ref name="db" />
[[Stephen Moore (writer)|Stephen Moore]], founder of the right-leaning limited-government group [[Club for Growth]] often relies on what he calls Erickson’s “clever and creative ideas.”<ref name=al>{{cite news|url=http://argusleader.newspapers.com/image/243919174|title=Why is this man after Daschle?|date=May 25, 2003|page=1A|newspaper=[[Argus Leader]]|first=David|last=Kranz}}</ref> However, Lee Schoenbeck, a former Republican Watertown Representative to the [[South Dakota House of Representatives]], has called him "the single biggest phony I’ve ever met in South Dakota politics."<ref name=rcj>{{cite news|url=http://rapidcityjournal.com/news/local/trump-putin-and-erickson-russia-probe-just-another-chapter-in/article_e9ed9038-3411-5112-86fa-f64bb0fa6549.html|title=Trump, Putin ... and Erickson? Russia probe just another chapter in South Dakotan's unusual life|newspaper=[[Rapid City Journal]]|date=February 11, 2018|first=Seth|last=Tupper}}</ref> Casey Phillips, a South Dakota Republican political consultant, has said of Erickson, "He likes to put people in touch with people. He’s a person that’s at the center of relationships all over the place."<ref name=rcj/>
== Business and legal career ==
Erickson worked as an [[executive producer]] of ''[[Red Scorpion]]'' (1988), an [[anti-communist]] action film produced by Jack Abramoff.<ref name="rcj" />
From 1993 to 1994, Erickson acted as a media adviser, agent, and lawyer for [[John and Lorena Bobbitt|John Wayne Bobbitt]], whose wife Lorena had cut off his penis with a kitchen knife. Erickson booked Bobbitt on an international "Love Hurts" tour during which Bobbitt made appearances on television shows such as ''[[The Howard Stern Show]]''.<ref name="rcj" />
In 1994, Erickson obtained a $30,000 contract with [[Jack Abramoff]] to lobby for entrance into the [[United States]] by [[Mobutu Sese Seko]], the [[military dictator]] of the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]] who had been banned from the entering the [[United States]] due to the corrupt and dictatorial nature of his regime.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/politics/1995/08/06/gop-activists-join-push-for-mobutu-visa/4aa2024b-0444-416f-b76a-c66c94c660a9/|title=GOP ACTIVISTS JOIN PUSH FOR MOBUTU VISA|last=Lippman|first=Thomas W.|date=1995-08-06|work=Washington Post|access-date=2018-03-30|language=en-US|issn=0190-8286}}</ref> Mobutu sought a visit to the [[United Nations]] to claim credit for this offer, but his visa request was ultimately denied due to his past human rights abuses.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Reno|first=William|date=|title=Sovereignty and Personal Rule in Zaire|url=http://asq.africa.ufl.edu/files/Reno-Vol-1-Issue-3.pdf|journal=African Studies Quarterly|volume=|pages=|via=}}</ref><ref name="rcj" />
In 1997, Erickson founded Compass Care, a senior living company based in South Dakota dedicated to developing non-nursing home care options for seniors in the Midwest. This venture led to senior care consulting spinoffs, independent living communities and the licensing of medical technology.<ref name=al/> Erickson and his companies have amassed at least seven [[judgment (law)|civil court judgment]]s against them over the years. In two such cases, lawsuits by investors in Compass Care alleged that Erickson had predicted investment returns of 25–100% but that neither investor received any returns and that Erickson had reneged on his promises to refund the original investments. One investor won a judgment for $115,417 in 2003 while another obtained a judgment for $190,000 in 2008. Two of Erickson's lawyers withdrew from the second case, one after Erickson wrote him a [[bad check]].<ref name="rcj" />
== NRA and Donald Trump's 2016 presidential campaign ==
Erickson has strong ties to both the [[National Rifle Association]] and the Russian gun rights community.<ref name=nyt/> He has supported [[Maria Butina]], now in jail awaiting her trial, who is a former assistant to [[Aleksandr Torshin]] and the founder of a Russian gun rights group called "The Right to Bear Arms". In 2016, Erickson and Butina set up a South Dakota business named "Bridges, LLC", which Erickson later said was created to provide financial assistance for Butina's graduate studies.<ref name="mcclatchy" />
During [[Donald Trump presidential campaign, 2016|Donald Trump's presidential campaign in 2016]], Erickson attempted to develop a [[Track II diplomacy|back-channel]] between the NRA and the [[Russian government]].<ref name="nyt" /> In May 2016, Erickson sent an e-mail with the subject line "Kremlin Connection" to Trump campaign adviser [[Rick Dearborn]] asking Dearborn and then-Senator [[Jeff Sessions]] for advice on setting up a meeting between Trump and Russian president [[Vladimir Putin]] at an annual NRA convention.<ref name="nyt" /><ref name="vf">{{cite journal|url=https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2018/01/donald-trump-robert-mueller-nra|title=Mueller’s Probe Is Dangerously Close to a Republican Red Line|journal=[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]|date=January 18, 2018|first=Abigail|last=Tracy}}</ref><ref name="rs">{{cite journal|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/news/the-trump-russia-nra-connection-heres-what-you-need-to-know-w515615|title=The Trump-Russia-NRA Connection: Here’s What You Need to Know|journal=[[The Rolling Stone]]|date=January 18, 2018|first=Tim|last=Dickinson}}</ref> After Trump won the presidential election in November 2016, Erickson said he was advising [[Trump transition team|his transition team]].<ref name="db" />
Erickson, Butina, and Torshin have been part of an investigation by the [[Senate Intelligence Committee]] into [[Russian interference in the 2016 United States elections]].<ref name="newsweek">{{cite journal|last=Maza|first=Cristina|date=November 29, 2017|title=NRA's Role In Connecting Trump Campaign With Russians Is Under Senate Investigation|url=http://www.newsweek.com/nra-trump-russia-senate-investigation-torshin-726656|journal=[[Newsweek]]}}</ref><ref name="mcclatchy">{{cite news|url=http://www.mcclatchydc.com/news/nation-world/national/article195231139.html|title=FBI investigating whether Russian money went to NRA to help Trump|agency=[[McClatchyDC]]|date=January 18, 2018|first1=Peter|last1=Stone|first2=Greg|last2=Gordon}}</ref> Torshin has also been the subject of a probe by the [[Federal Bureau of Investigations]] into whether the Russian government attempted to illegally funnel money to the NRA in order to help Trump win the presidency.<ref name="mak">{{citeweb|last=Mak|first=Tim|url=https://www.npr.org/2018/03/01/590076949/depth-of-russian-politicians-cultivation-of-nra-ties-revealed|title=Depth Of Russian Politician's Cultivation Of NRA Ties Revealed|website=NPR|date=March 1, 2018|access-date=April 7, 2018}}</ref> In July 2018 Butina was arrested by the FBI and charged with conspiring to act as an unregistered agent of the [[Russian Federation]]. In Butina's indictment, federal prosecutors said an unnamed American political operative, later identified as Erickson, had worked with Butina to arrange introductions to influential people inside the U.S. and to advance Russian interests.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.npr.org/2018/07/16/629531772/feds-charge-russian-student-linked-to-nra-with-conspiracy|title=Feds Charge Russian Student, Linked To NRA, With Conspiracy|publisher=[[NPR]]|date=July 16, 2018|first=Carrie|last=Johnson}}</ref>
== Religious activities == Erickson served a term on the board of directors of the Institute for Lutheran Theology.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://issuu.com/instituteoflutherantheology/docs/ilt_summer_newsletter2012|title=the Word at Work, the magazine of the Institute of Lutheran Theology, Summer 2012|work=Issuu|access-date=2018-03-30|language=en}}</ref>
In 1997 Erickson helped to organize a religious revival service on the [[National Mall]] in Washington, D.C., sponsored by the [[Promise Keepers]], an [[Evangelical Christian]] men's organization.<ref name=al/> Hundreds of thousands of men participated in the day-long service.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/US/9710/04/promise.keepers.pm/|title=Promise Keepers fill Washington's Mall with prayer|date=October 4, 1997|access-date=2018-04-03}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.christianpost.com/news/250-000-christian-men-to-re-ignite-old-flame-27485/|title=250,000 Christian Men to Re-Ignite Old Flame|access-date=2018-03-30|language=en}}</ref>
== Personal life == Erickson is single and has never married.<ref name=rcj/> He has homes in New York, [[Los Angeles]], and [[Sioux Falls, South Dakota]].<ref name=rcj/>
According to criminal charges against Butina, Erickson and Butina lived together and were in a sexual relationship, which Butina was using to advance Russian national interests. According to prosecutors, Butina "privately expressed 'disdain' for him".<ref>{{cite news |last1=Goldman |first1=Adam |last2=LaFraniere |first2=Sharon |title=Maria Butina, Suspected Secret Agent, Used Sex in Covert Plan, Prosecutors Say |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/07/18/us/politics/maria-butina-russia-espionage.html |accessdate=18 July 2018 |work=The New York Times |date=18 July 2018}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Timeline of investigations into Trump and Russia (2018)]]
